concept.title: Index creation phases
concept.shortdesc: An index is created by the CREATE INDEX command.

conbody.p:
Issuing the CREATE INDEX command is considered the first part of a two phase process.
Prepare phase - This phase occurs when the CREATE INDEX command is issued. Index metadata (for example, ID and topology) is generated and storage is allocated for the new index. The CREATE INDEX command is issued either at the command line via the Query service or by an application through the Query service.
Load phase - This phase initiates the mutation stream for the new index and the indexer process and stores the primary or secondary keys.
